alert.note: Alert for San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 7:52PM MDT until July 25 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE SOUTHERN HERMITS PEAK AND CALF CANYON BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING IN NORTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL COUNTY... At 752 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms continuing to produce light to moderate rain over the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Up to 0.94 inches of rain have fallen to the southeast and east of Gallinas. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will mainly impact the Gallinas River drainage below Gallinas, as well as Agua Zarca. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Hermits Peak and Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Las Vegas, El Porvenir, Montezuma, Storrie Lake State Park, Mineral Hill, Gallinas, San Geronimo, San Pablo and Ojitos Frios. This includes the following highways... State Road 283 between Mile Markers 1 and 12...and near Mile Marker 14. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 1 and 14. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 1 and 10. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 344 and 348. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
